import { Post } from "@/interfaces/post";
import fs from "fs";
import matter from "gray-matter";
import { join } from "path";

const postsDirectory = join(process.cwd(), "_posts");

export function getPostSlugs() {
  return fs.readdirSync(postsDirectory);
}

export function getPostBySlug(slug: string) {
  const realSlug = slug.replace(/\.md$/, "");
  const fullPath = join(postsDirectory, `${realSlug}.md`);
  const fileContents = fs.readFileSync(fullPath, "utf8");
  const { data, content } = matter(fileContents);

  return { ...data, slug: realSlug, content } as Post;
}

export function getAllPosts(): Post[] {
  const slugs = getPostSlugs();
  const posts = slugs
    .map((slug) => getPostBySlug(slug))
    // sort posts by date in descending order
    .sort((post1, post2) => (post1.date > post2.date ? -1 : 1));
  return posts;
}

# Issue Title: Update Nails Article and Lash Extension Article

## Benefit Hypothesis
Enable website visitors to read about the business origin of the art of nail design.

## Story Context
Users are seeking in-depth information about the business origins of the art of nail design.

## Objective
Provide a unified and detailed presentation of the business origins of nail design across the site, ensuring consistency and SEO optimization between related content pieces.

## Technical Solution
- **Allowed Edits:** Only the following two files are allowed to be edited:
  - `nails.md`
  - `lash-extension.md`
### Implementation Steps
- 1.For the **nails.md** article:
  - Must be authored by **Hang**.
  - **Cover image path**, **author picture path**, and **ogImage** must remain the same.
  - Write an article about the business origins of nail design 
- 2.For the **lash-extension.md**:
  - Use the **same** `coverImage`, `date`, `author`, `name`, `picture`, `ogImage`, and `url` as in `nails.md`.
  - Ensure a **SEO-friendly excerpt** and **title**.
  - Write an article about lash extensions, to learn about the transformative power of lash extensions and how they enhance the natural beauty of women. Additionally write about the types of lashes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- The **Nails** article must be authored by **Hang**.
- The **nails.md** file retains its original **cover image path**, **author picture path**, and **ogImage**.
- The **lash-extension.md** file matches the metadata (i.e., `coverImage`, `date`, `author`, `name`, `picture`, `ogImage`, and `url`) from `nails.md` and includes a **SEO-friendly excerpt** and **title**.

## About HA Beauty Lashes

HA Beauty Lashes was established in 2020 in Glienicke Nordbahn, as an extension of the renowned Ha Beauty brand. Our journey began with a passion for enhancing natural beauty through expertly crafted lash extensions. Since our inception, we have dedicated ourselves to providing high-quality lash services that not only beautify but also empower our clients.

Our team of skilled professionals is trained in the latest techniques and trends in lash extensions, ensuring that every client receives personalized care and attention. We believe that every woman deserves to feel beautiful and confident, and our mission is to help them achieve that effortlessly.

At HA Beauty Lashes, we pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction. We continuously strive to innovate and improve our services, making us the go-to destination for lash extensions in Glienicke and beyond.

---
title: "The Comprehensive Guide to Lash Extensions"
excerpt: "Everything you need to know about lash extensions, trends, and professional insights."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
date: "2024-12-12T05:35:07.322Z"
author:
  name: Hang
  picture: "/assets/blog/authors/hang.png"
ogImage:
  url: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
---
## The Comprehensive Guide to Lash Extensions

Lash extensions have become a popular beauty trend, offering a way to enhance the length and volume of natural lashes. This guide will provide you with everything you need to know about lash extensions, including the different types, application techniques, and aftercare tips.

### Types of Lash Extensions

1. **Classic Lash Extensions**: These are individual lashes applied to each natural lash, providing a natural look.
2. **Volume Lash Extensions**: Multiple lightweight lashes are applied to each natural lash, creating a fuller and more dramatic effect.
3. **Hybrid Lash Extensions**: A mix of classic and volume techniques, offering a balanced look.

### Application Techniques

The application of lash extensions should always be performed by a trained professional to ensure safety and optimal results. The process typically involves:

- A consultation to determine the desired look.
- Preparation of the natural lashes.
- Application of the extensions using a specialized adhesive.

### Trends in Lash Extensions

As the beauty industry evolves, so do the trends in lash extensions. Some current trends include:

- **Colored Lash Extensions**: Adding a pop of color to your lashes for a fun and unique look.
- **Lash Lifts**: A treatment that curls and lifts natural lashes without extensions, providing a more natural enhancement.

### Professional Insights

To maintain the longevity of your lash extensions, proper aftercare is essential. Here are some tips:

- Avoid water and steam for the first 24 hours after application.
- Use oil-free makeup removers.
- Schedule regular touch-ups every 2-3 weeks to keep your lashes looking their best.

At HA Beauty Lashes, we are committed to providing our clients with the best lash extension services and education. Our goal is to help you achieve stunning, effortless beauty that lasts.

import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import { EXAMPLE_PATH } from "@/lib/constants";
import cn from "classnames";

type Props = {
  preview?: boolean;
};

const Alert = ({ preview }: Props) => {
  return (
    <div
      className={cn("border-b dark:bg-slate-800", {
        "bg-neutral-800 border-neutral-800 text-white": preview,
        "bg-neutral-50 border-neutral-200": !preview,
      })}
    >
      <Container>
        <div className="py-2 text-center text-sm">
          {preview ? (
            <>
              This page is a preview.{" "}
              <a
                href="/api/exit-preview"
                className="underline hover:text-teal-300 duration-200 transition-colors"
              >
                Click here
              </a>{" "}
              to exit preview mode.
            </>
          ) : (
            <>
              The source code for this blog is{" "}
              <a
                href={`https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/examples/${EXAMPLE_PATH}`}
                className="underline hover:text-blue-600 duration-200 transition-colors"
              >
                available on GitHub
              </a>
              .
            </>
          )}
        </div>
      </Container>
    </div>
  );
};

export default Alert;

import cn from "classnames";
import Link from "next/link";
import Image from "next/image";

type Props = {
  title: string;
  src: string;
  slug?: string;
};

const CoverImage = ({ title, src, slug }: Props) => {
  const image = (
    <Image
      src={src}
      alt={`Cover Image for ${title}`}
      className={cn("shadow-sm w-full", {
        "hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow duration-200": slug,
      })}
      width={1300}
      height={630}
    />
  );
  return (
    <div className="sm:mx-0">
      {slug ? (
        <Link href={`/posts/${slug}`} aria-label={title}>
          {image}
        </Link>
      ) : (
        image
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default CoverImage;

import { parseISO, format } from "date-fns";

type Props = {
  dateString: string;
};

const DateFormatter = ({ dateString }: Props) => {
  const date = parseISO(dateString);
  return <time dateTime={dateString}>{format(date, "LLLL	d, yyyy")}</time>;
};

export default DateFormatter;

import Avatar from "@/app/_components/avatar";
import CoverImage from "@/app/_components/cover-image";
import { type Author } from "@/interfaces/author";
import Link from "next/link";
import DateFormatter from "./date-formatter";

type Props = {
  title: string;
  coverImage: string;
  date: string;
  excerpt: string;
  author: Author;
  slug: string;
};

export function HeroPost({
  title,
  coverImage,
  date,
  excerpt,
  author,
  slug,
}: Props) {
  return (
    <section>
      <div className="mb-8 md:mb-16">
        <CoverImage title={title} src={coverImage} slug={slug} />
      </div>
      <div className="md:grid md:grid-cols-2 md:gap-x-16 lg:gap-x-8 mb-20 md:mb-28">
        <div>
          <h3 className="mb-4 text-4xl lg:text-5xl leading-tight">
            <Link href={`/posts/${slug}`} className="hover:underline">
              {title}
            </Link>
          </h3>
          <div className="mb-4 md:mb-0 text-lg">
            <DateFormatter dateString={date} />
          </div>
        </div>
        <div>
          <p className="text-lg leading-relaxed mb-4">{excerpt}</p>
          <Avatar name={author.name} picture={author.picture} />
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}

.switch {
  all: unset;
  position: absolute;
  right: 20px;
  top: 70px;
  display: inline-block;
  color: currentColor;
  border-radius: 50%;
  border: 1px dashed currentColor;
  cursor: pointer;
  --size: 24px;
  height: var(--size);
  width: var(--size);
  transition: all 0.3s ease-in-out 0s !important;
}

[data-mode="system"] .switch::after {
  position: absolute;
  height: 100%;
  width: 100%;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-size: calc(var(--size) / 2);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  content: "A";
}

[data-mode="light"] .switch {
  box-shadow: 0 0 50px 10px yellow;
  background-color: yellow;
  border: 1px solid orangered;
}

[data-mode="dark"] .switch {
  box-shadow: calc(var(--size) / 4) calc(var(--size) / -4) calc(var(--size) / 8)
    inset #fff;
  border: none;
  background: transparent;
  animation: n linear 0.5s;
}

@keyframes n {
  40% {
    transform: rotate(-15deg);
  }
  80% {
    transform: rotate(10deg);
  }
  0%,
  100% {
    transform: rotate(0deg);
  }
}

"use client";

import styles from "./switch.module.css";
import { memo, useEffect, useState } from "react";

declare global {
  var updateDOM: () => void;
}

type ColorSchemePreference = "system" | "dark" | "light";

const STORAGE_KEY = "nextjs-blog-starter-theme";
const modes: ColorSchemePreference[] = ["system", "dark", "light"];

/** to reuse updateDOM function defined inside injected script */

/** function to be injected in script tag for avoiding FOUC (Flash of Unstyled Content) */
export const NoFOUCScript = (storageKey: string) => {
  /* can not use outside constants or function as this script will be injected in a different context */
  const [SYSTEM, DARK, LIGHT] = ["system", "dark", "light"];

  /** Modify transition globally to avoid patched transitions */
  const modifyTransition = () => {
    const css = document.createElement("style");
    css.textContent = "*,*:after,*:before{transition:none !important;}";
    document.head.appendChild(css);

    return () => {
      /* Force restyle */
      getComputedStyle(document.body);
      /* Wait for next tick before removing */
      setTimeout(() => document.head.removeChild(css), 1);
    };
  };

  const media = matchMedia(`(prefers-color-scheme: ${DARK})`);

  /** function to add remove dark class */
  window.updateDOM = () => {
    const restoreTransitions = modifyTransition();
    const mode = localStorage.getItem(storageKey) ?? SYSTEM;
    const systemMode = media.matches ? DARK : LIGHT;
    const resolvedMode = mode === SYSTEM ? systemMode : mode;
    const classList = document.documentElement.classList;
    if (resolvedMode === DARK) classList.add(DARK);
    else classList.remove(DARK);
    document.documentElement.setAttribute("data-mode", mode);
    restoreTransitions();
  };
  window.updateDOM();
  media.addEventListener("change", window.updateDOM);
};

let updateDOM: () => void;

/**
 * Switch button to quickly toggle user preference.
 */
const Switch = () => {
  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ColorSchemePreference>(
    () =>
      ((typeof localStorage !== "undefined" &&
        localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY)) ??
        "system") as ColorSchemePreference,
  );

  useEffect(() => {
    // store global functions to local variables to avoid any interference
    updateDOM = window.updateDOM;
    /** Sync the tabs */
    addEventListener("storage", (e: StorageEvent): void => {
      e.key === STORAGE_KEY && setMode(e.newValue as ColorSchemePreference);
    });
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, mode);
    updateDOM();
  }, [mode]);

  /** toggle mode */
  const handleModeSwitch = () => {
    const index = modes.indexOf(mode);
    setMode(modes[(index + 1) % modes.length]);
  };
  return (
    <button
      suppressHydrationWarning
      className={styles.switch}
      onClick={handleModeSwitch}
    />
  );
};

const Script = memo(() => (
  <script
    dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
      __html: `(${NoFOUCScript.toString()})('${STORAGE_KEY}')`,
    }}
  />
));

/**
 * This component wich applies classes and transitions.
 */
export const ThemeSwitcher = () => {
  return (
    <>
      <Script />
      <Switch />
    </>
  );
};

import { Metadata } from "next";
import { notFound } from "next/navigation";
import { getAllPosts, getPostBySlug } from "@/lib/api";
import { CMS_NAME } from "@/lib/constants";
import markdownToHtml from "@/lib/markdownToHtml";
import Alert from "@/app/_components/alert";
import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import Header from "@/app/_components/header";
import { PostBody } from "@/app/_components/post-body";
import { PostHeader } from "@/app/_components/post-header";

export default async function Post(props: Params) {
  const params = await props.params;
  const post = getPostBySlug(params.slug);

  if (!post) {
    return notFound();
  }

  const content = await markdownToHtml(post.content || "");

  return (
    <main>
      <Alert preview={post.preview} />
      <Container>
        <Header />
        <article className="mb-32">
          <PostHeader
            title={post.title}
            coverImage={post.coverImage}
            date={post.date}
            author={post.author}
          />
          <PostBody content={content} />
        </article>
      </Container>
    </main>
  );
}

type Params = {
  params: Promise<{
    slug: string;
  }>;
};

export async function generateMetadata(props: Params): Promise<Metadata> {
  const params = await props.params;
  const post = getPostBySlug(params.slug);

  if (!post) {
    return notFound();
  }

  const title = `${post.title} | Next.js Blog Example with ${CMS_NAME}`;

  return {
    title,
    openGraph: {
      title,
      images: [post.ogImage.url],
    },
  };
}

export async function generateStaticParams() {
  const posts = getAllPosts();

  return posts.map((post) => ({
    slug: post.slug,
  }));
}

import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import { HeroPost } from "@/app/_components/hero-post";
import { Intro } from "@/app/_components/intro";
import { MoreStories } from "@/app/_components/more-stories";
import { getAllPosts } from "@/lib/api";

export default function Index() {
  const allPosts = getAllPosts();

  const heroPost = allPosts[0];

  const morePosts = allPosts.slice(1);

  return (
    <main>
      <Container>
        <Intro />
        <HeroPost
          title={heroPost.title}
          coverImage={heroPost.coverImage}
          date={heroPost.date}
          author={heroPost.author}
          slug={heroPost.slug}
          excerpt={heroPost.excerpt}
        />
        {morePosts.length > 0 && <MoreStories posts={morePosts} />}
      </Container>
    </main>
  );
}

import { Post } from "@/interfaces/post";
import fs from "fs";
import matter from "gray-matter";
import { join } from "path";

const postsDirectory = join(process.cwd(), "_posts");

export function getPostSlugs() {
  return fs.readdirSync(postsDirectory);
}

export function getPostBySlug(slug: string) {
  const realSlug = slug.replace(/\.md$/, "");
  const fullPath = join(postsDirectory, `${realSlug}.md`);
  const fileContents = fs.readFileSync(fullPath, "utf8");
  const { data, content } = matter(fileContents);

  return { ...data, slug: realSlug, content } as Post;
}

export function getAllPosts(): Post[] {
  const slugs = getPostSlugs();
  const posts = slugs
    .map((slug) => getPostBySlug(slug))
    // sort posts by date in descending order
    .sort((post1, post2) => (post1.date > post2.date ? -1 : 1));
  return posts;
}

import { remark } from "remark";
import html from "remark-html";

export default async function markdownToHtml(markdown: string) {
  const result = await remark().use(html).process(markdown);
  return result.toString();
}

Nail design has a rich history that dates back thousands of years, with its origins rooted in ancient civilizations. The art of nail design has evolved significantly over the years, influenced by cultural trends, fashion, and technological advancements. 

In ancient Egypt, both men and women adorned their nails with henna, a practice that symbolized wealth and status. The use of nail polish can be traced back to the Ming Dynasty in China, where a mixture of beeswax, egg whites, and colored powders was used to create beautiful nail colors.

As the centuries progressed, nail design became more sophisticated. The introduction of modern nail polish in the 20th century revolutionized the industry, allowing for a wider variety of colors and finishes. Today, nail design is not just a beauty trend but a form of self-expression, with techniques ranging from simple manicures to intricate nail art.

At HA Beauty, we celebrate the art of nail design by offering a range of services that highlight the beauty and creativity of our clients. Our skilled technicians are trained in the latest techniques and trends, ensuring that every client leaves feeling beautiful and confident.

Lash extensions have become a revolutionary beauty trend, offering women the opportunity to enhance their natural beauty effortlessly. Since their introduction, lash extensions have transformed the way women approach their beauty routines, providing a solution for those seeking longer, fuller lashes without the need for mascara.

There are several types of lash extensions available, each designed to cater to different preferences and styles:

1. **Classic Lash Extensions**: These involve applying a single extension to each natural lash, creating a natural and elegant look.
2. **Volume Lash Extensions**: This technique uses multiple lightweight extensions to create a fuller, more dramatic effect, perfect for those who desire a bolder look.
3. **Hybrid Lash Extensions**: A combination of classic and volume techniques, offering a balanced look that suits various eye shapes and styles.

At HA Beauty, we pride ourselves on our expertise in lash extensions. Our trained professionals ensure that each application is done with precision and care, allowing our clients to enjoy stunning, long-lasting results. We also provide essential aftercare tips to maintain the longevity of your lash extensions, ensuring that you can enjoy your beautiful lashes for weeks to come.

Our mission is to empower women through beauty, helping them feel confident and radiant with every blink.

Nail design has a rich history that dates back thousands of years, with its origins rooted in ancient civilizations. The art of nail design has evolved significantly over the years, influenced by cultural trends, fashion, and technological advancements. 

In ancient Egypt, both men and women adorned their nails with henna, a practice that symbolized wealth and status. The use of nail polish can be traced back to the Ming Dynasty in China, where a mixture of beeswax, egg whites, and colored powders was used to create beautiful nail colors.

As the centuries progressed, nail design became more sophisticated. The introduction of modern nail polish in the 20th century revolutionized the industry, allowing for a wider variety of colors and finishes. Today, nail design is not just a beauty trend but a form of self-expression, with techniques ranging from simple manicures to intricate nail art.

At HA Beauty, we celebrate the art of nail design by offering a range of services that highlight the beauty and creativity of our clients. Our skilled technicians are trained in the latest techniques and trends, ensuring that every client leaves feeling beautiful and confident.

## About HA Beauty Lashes

HA Beauty Lashes was established in 2020 in Glienicke Nordbahn, as an extension of the renowned Ha Beauty brand. Our journey began with a passion for enhancing natural beauty through expertly crafted lash extensions. Since our inception, we have dedicated ourselves to providing high-quality lash services that not only beautify but also empower our clients.

Our team of skilled professionals is trained in the latest techniques and trends in lash extensions, ensuring that every client receives personalized care and attention. We believe that every woman deserves to feel beautiful and confident, and our mission is to help them achieve that effortlessly.

At HA Beauty Lashes, we pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction. We continuously strive to innovate and improve our services, making us the go-to destination for lash extensions in Glienicke and beyond.

title: "The Transformative Power of Lash Extensions"
excerpt: "Explore the transformative power of lash extensions and how they enhance natural beauty."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"

Lash extensions have become a revolutionary beauty trend, offering women the opportunity to enhance their natural beauty effortlessly. Since their introduction, lash extensions have transformed the way women approach their beauty routines, providing a solution for those seeking longer, fuller lashes without the need for mascara.

There are several types of lash extensions available, each designed to cater to different preferences and styles:

1. **Classic Lash Extensions**: These involve applying a single extension to each natural lash, creating a natural and elegant look.
2. **Volume Lash Extensions**: This technique uses multiple lightweight extensions to create a fuller, more dramatic effect, perfect for those who desire a bolder look.
3. **Hybrid Lash Extensions**: A combination of classic and volume techniques, offering a balanced look that suits various eye shapes and styles.

At HA Beauty, we pride ourselves on our expertise in lash extensions. Our trained professionals ensure that each application is done with precision and care, allowing our clients to enjoy stunning, long-lasting results. We also provide essential aftercare tips to maintain the longevity of your lash extensions, ensuring that you can enjoy your beautiful lashes for weeks to come.

Our mission is to empower women through beauty, helping them feel confident and radiant with every blink.

---
title: "The Comprehensive Guide to Lash Extensions"
excerpt: "Everything you need to know about lash extensions, trends, and professional insights."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
date: "2024-12-12T05:35:07.322Z"
author:
  name: Hang
  picture: "/assets/blog/authors/hang.png"
ogImage:

---
## The Comprehensive Guide to Lash Extensions

Lash extensions have become a popular beauty trend, offering a way to enhance the length and volume of natural lashes. This guide will provide you with everything you need to know about lash extensions, including the different types, application techniques, and aftercare tips.

### Types of Lash Extensions

1. **Classic Lash Extensions**: These are individual lashes applied to each natural lash, providing a natural look.
2. **Volume Lash Extensions**: Multiple lightweight lashes are applied to each natural lash, creating a fuller and more dramatic effect.
3. **Hybrid Lash Extensions**: A mix of classic and volume techniques, offering a balanced look.

### Application Techniques

The application of lash extensions should always be performed by a trained professional to ensure safety and optimal results. The process typically involves:

- A consultation to determine the desired look.
- Preparation of the natural lashes.
- Application of the extensions using a specialized adhesive.

### Trends in Lash Extensions

As the beauty industry evolves, so do the trends in lash extensions. Some current trends include:

- **Colored Lash Extensions**: Adding a pop of color to your lashes for a fun and unique look.
- **Lash Lifts**: A treatment that curls and lifts natural lashes without extensions, providing a more natural enhancement.

### Professional Insights

To maintain the longevity of your lash extensions, proper aftercare is essential. Here are some tips:

- Avoid water and steam for the first 24 hours after application.
- Use oil-free makeup removers.
- Schedule regular touch-ups every 2-3 weeks to keep your lashes looking their best.

At HA Beauty Lashes, we are committed to providing our clients with the best lash extension services and education. Our goal is to help you achieve stunning, effortless beauty that lasts.

import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import { EXAMPLE_PATH } from "@/lib/constants";
import cn from "classnames";

type Props = {
  preview?: boolean;
};

const Alert = ({ preview }: Props) => {
  return (
    <div
      className={cn("border-b dark:bg-slate-800", {
        "bg-neutral-800 border-neutral-800 text-white": preview,
        "bg-neutral-50 border-neutral-200": !preview,
      })}
    >
      <Container>
        <div className="py-2 text-center text-sm">
          {preview ? (
            <>
              This page is a preview.{" "}
              <a
                href="/api/exit-preview"
                className="underline hover:text-teal-300 duration-200 transition-colors"
              >
                Click here
              </a>{" "}
              to exit preview mode.
            </>
          ) : (
            <>
              The source code for this blog is{" "}
              <a
                href={`https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/examples/${EXAMPLE_PATH}`}
                className="underline hover:text-blue-600 duration-200 transition-colors"
              >
                available on GitHub
              </a>
              .
            </>
          )}
        </div>
      </Container>
    </div>
  );
};

export default Alert;

import cn from "classnames";
import Link from "next/link";
import Image from "next/image";

type Props = {
  title: string;
  src: string;
  slug?: string;
};

const CoverImage = ({ title, src, slug }: Props) => {
  const image = (
    <Image
      src={src}
      alt={`Cover Image for ${title}`}
      className={cn("shadow-sm w-full", {
        "hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow duration-200": slug,
      })}
      width={1300}
      height={630}
    />
  );
  return (
    <div className="sm:mx-0">
      {slug ? (
        <Link href={`/posts/${slug}`} aria-label={title}>
          {image}
        </Link>
      ) : (
        image
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

.switch {
  all: unset;
  position: absolute;
  right: 20px;
  top: 70px;
  display: inline-block;
  color: currentColor;
  border-radius: 50%;
  border: 1px dashed currentColor;
  cursor: pointer;
  --size: 24px;
  height: var(--size);
  width: var(--size);
  transition: all 0.3s ease-in-out 0s !important;
}

[data-mode="system"] .switch::after {
  position: absolute;
  height: 100%;
  width: 100%;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-size: calc(var(--size) / 2);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  content: "A";
}

[data-mode="light"] .switch {
  box-shadow: 0 0 50px 10px yellow;
  background-color: yellow;
  border: 1px solid orangered;
}

[data-mode="dark"] .switch {
  box-shadow: calc(var(--size) / 4) calc(var(--size) / -4) calc(var(--size) / 8)
    inset #fff;
  border: none;
  background: transparent;
  animation: n linear 0.5s;
}

@keyframes n {
  40% {
    transform: rotate(-15deg);
  }
  80% {
    transform: rotate(10deg);
  }
  0%,
  100% {
    transform: rotate(0deg);
  }
}

"use client";

import styles from "./switch.module.css";
import { memo, useEffect, useState } from "react";

declare global {
  var updateDOM: () => void;
}

type ColorSchemePreference = "system" | "dark" | "light";

const STORAGE_KEY = "nextjs-blog-starter-theme";
const modes: ColorSchemePreference[] = ["system", "dark", "light"];

/** to reuse updateDOM function defined inside injected script */

/** function to be injected in script tag for avoiding FOUC (Flash of Unstyled Content) */
export const NoFOUCScript = (storageKey: string) => {
  /* can not use outside constants or function as this script will be injected in a different context */
  const [SYSTEM, DARK, LIGHT] = ["system", "dark", "light"];

  /** Modify transition globally to avoid patched transitions */
  const modifyTransition = () => {
    const css = document.createElement("style");
    css.textContent = "*,*:after,*:before{transition:none !important;}";
    document.head.appendChild(css);

    return () => {
      /* Force restyle */
      getComputedStyle(document.body);
      /* Wait for next tick before removing */
      setTimeout(() => document.head.removeChild(css), 1);
    };
  };

  const media = matchMedia(`(prefers-color-scheme: ${DARK})`);

  /** function to add remove dark class */
  window.updateDOM = () => {
    const restoreTransitions = modifyTransition();
    const mode = localStorage.getItem(storageKey) ?? SYSTEM;
    const systemMode = media.matches ? DARK : LIGHT;
    const resolvedMode = mode === SYSTEM ? systemMode : mode;
    const classList = document.documentElement.classList;
    if (resolvedMode === DARK) classList.add(DARK);
    else classList.remove(DARK);
    document.documentElement.setAttribute("data-mode", mode);
    restoreTransitions();
  };
  window.updateDOM();
  media.addEventListener("change", window.updateDOM);
};

let updateDOM: () => void;

/**
 * Switch button to quickly toggle user preference.
 */
const Switch = () => {
  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ColorSchemePreference>(
    () =>
      ((typeof localStorage !== "undefined" &&
        localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY)) ??
        "system") as ColorSchemePreference,
  );

  useEffect(() => {
    // store global functions to local variables to avoid any interference
    updateDOM = window.updateDOM;
    /** Sync the tabs */
    addEventListener("storage", (e: StorageEvent): void => {
      e.key === STORAGE_KEY && setMode(e.newValue as ColorSchemePreference);
    });
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, mode);
    updateDOM();
  }, [mode]);

  /** toggle mode */
  const handleModeSwitch = () => {
    const index = modes.indexOf(mode);
    setMode(modes[(index + 1) % modes.length]);
  };
  return (
    <button
      suppressHydrationWarning
      className={styles.switch}
      onClick={handleModeSwitch}
    />
  );
};

const Script = memo(() => (
  <script
    dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
      __html: `(${NoFOUCScript.toString()})('${STORAGE_KEY}')`,
    }}
  />
));

/**
 * This component wich applies classes and transitions.
 */
export const ThemeSwitcher = () => {
  return (
    <>
      <Script />
      <Switch />
    </>
  );
};

import { Metadata } from "next";
import { notFound } from "next/navigation";
import { getAllPosts, getPostBySlug } from "@/lib/api";
import { CMS_NAME } from "@/lib/constants";
import markdownToHtml from "@/lib/markdownToHtml";
import Alert from "@/app/_components/alert";
import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import Header from "@/app/_components/header";
import { PostBody } from "@/app/_components/post-body";
import { PostHeader } from "@/app/_components/post-header";

export default async function Post(props: Params) {
  const params = await props.params;
  const post = getPostBySlug(params.slug);

  if (!post) {
    return notFound();
  }

  const content = await markdownToHtml(post.content || "");

  return (
    <main>
      <Alert preview={post.preview} />
      <Container>
        <Header />
        <article className="mb-32">
          <PostHeader
            title={post.title}
            coverImage={post.coverImage}
            date={post.date}
            author={post.author}
          />
          <PostBody content={content} />
        </article>
      </Container>
    </main>
  );
}

type Params = {
  params: Promise<{
    slug: string;
  }>;
};

export async function generateMetadata(props: Params): Promise<Metadata> {
  const params = await props.params;
  const post = getPostBySlug(params.slug);

  if (!post) {
    return notFound();
  }

  const title = `${post.title} | Next.js Blog Example with ${CMS_NAME}`;

  return {
    title,
    openGraph: {
      title,
      images: [post.ogImage.url],
    },
  };
}

export async function generateStaticParams() {
  const posts = getAllPosts();

  return posts.map((post) => ({
    slug: post.slug,
  }));
}

import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import { HeroPost } from "@/app/_components/hero-post";
import { Intro } from "@/app/_components/intro";
import { MoreStories } from "@/app/_components/more-stories";
import { getAllPosts } from "@/lib/api";

export default function Index() {
  const allPosts = getAllPosts();

  const heroPost = allPosts[0];

  const morePosts = allPosts.slice(1);

  return (
    <main>
      <Container>
        <Intro />
        <HeroPost
          title={heroPost.title}
          coverImage={heroPost.coverImage}
          date={heroPost.date}
          author={heroPost.author}
          slug={heroPost.slug}
          excerpt={heroPost.excerpt}
        />
        {morePosts.length > 0 && <MoreStories posts={morePosts} />}
      </Container>
    </main>
  );
}

import { Post } from "@/interfaces/post";
import fs from "fs";
import matter from "gray-matter";
import { join } from "path";

const postsDirectory = join(process.cwd(), "_posts");

export function getPostSlugs() {
  return fs.readdirSync(postsDirectory);
}

export function getPostBySlug(slug: string) {
  const realSlug = slug.replace(/\.md$/, "");
  const fullPath = join(postsDirectory, `${realSlug}.md`);
  const fileContents = fs.readFileSync(fullPath, "utf8");
  const { data, content } = matter(fileContents);

  return { ...data, slug: realSlug, content } as Post;
}

export function getAllPosts(): Post[] {
  const slugs = getPostSlugs();
  const posts = slugs
    .map((slug) => getPostBySlug(slug))
    // sort posts by date in descending order
    .sort((post1, post2) => (post1.date > post2.date ? -1 : 1));
  return posts;
}

import { remark } from "remark";
import html from "remark-html";

export default async function markdownToHtml(markdown: string) {
  const result = await remark().use(html).process(markdown);
  return result.toString();
}

# Issue title: Instagram Icon and website link integration in the footer 

## Benefit Hypothesis

Integrating an Instagram icon and a direct link to the main website in the footer will enhance user engagement by providing quick, easy access to our social media presence and primary online resource. This update is expected to:

- **Increase Social Media Engagement:** By prominently displaying the Instagram icon, users are more likely to connect with and follow our social media account, leading to higher engagement rates.
- **Improve Navigation:** Offering a direct link to the main website in the footer simplifies user navigation, ensuring that visitors can easily explore more of our content and offerings.
- **Boost Brand Exposure:** The dual-link approach reinforces our brand presence across platforms, potentially increasing trust and conversion rates as users seamlessly transition between social media and our website.
- **Enhance User Experience:** The clean integration of social media and main website links contributes to a modern, user-friendly interface that aligns with best practices in web development and design.

## Objective
Enable quick access to the website owner's Instagram profile, and include a link in the footer to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).

## Story Context
Users want a direct way to connect with the website owner on social media and navigate to the main website.

## Technical Requirements
- **Framework:** Next.js
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS
- **Language:** TypeScript

## Codebase Changes

1. **package.json**
   - Add `react-icons` as a dependency ( No comments should be added to the code.)
2. **Footer Component**
   - Import the Instagram icon from `react-icons`.
   - Add the Instagram icon with a link to: [https://www.instagram.com/habeauty.de/](https://www.instagram.com/habeauty.de/).
   - Add a link to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).

## Implementation Steps

1. Install the `react-icons` package and update the `package.json`.
2. Add the Instagram icon to the footer component.
3. Link the Instagram icon to the Instagram profile.
4. Add a link in the footer that directs to the main website.
5. No comments should be added to the code.

## Acceptance Criteria

- The icon must be present in the footer.
- The Instagram icon is correctly imported from `react-icons`.
- The Instagram icon is linked to the Instagram profile.
- The footer includes a link to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).
- All new dependencies are properly added to the `package.json`.
- No comments should be added to the code.

## Key Guidelines

- Write clean, maintainable code.
- Follow Next.js and Tailwind CSS best practices.
- Ensure the integration is both functional and visually appealing.
- No comments should be added to the code.

---

## About HA Beauty Lashes

HA Beauty Lashes was established in 2020 in Glienicke Nordbahn, as an extension of the renowned Ha Beauty brand. Our journey began with a passion for enhancing natural beauty through expertly crafted lash extensions. Since our inception, we have dedicated ourselves to providing high-quality lash services that not only beautify but also empower our clients.

Our team of skilled professionals is trained in the latest techniques and trends in lash extensions, ensuring that every client receives personalized care and attention. We believe that every woman deserves to feel beautiful and confident, and our mission is to help them achieve that effortlessly.

At HA Beauty Lashes, we pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction. We continuously strive to innovate and improve our services, making us the go-to destination for lash extensions in Glienicke and beyond.

File: _posts/lash-extension.md

---
title: "The Transformative Power of Lash Extensions"
excerpt: "Explore the transformative power of lash extensions and how they enhance natural beauty."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
date: "2024-12-14T05:35:07.322Z"
author:
  name: Hang
  picture: "/assets/blog/authors/hang.png"
ogImage:
  url: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
---

Lash extensions have become a revolutionary beauty trend, offering women the opportunity to enhance their natural beauty effortlessly. Since their introduction, lash extensions have transformed the way women approach their beauty routines, providing a solution for those seeking longer, fuller lashes without the need for mascara.

There are several types of lash extensions available, each designed to cater to different preferences and styles:

1. **Classic Lash Extensions**: These involve applying a single extension to each natural lash, creating a natural and elegant look.
2. **Volume Lash Extensions**: This technique uses multiple lightweight extensions to create a fuller, more dramatic effect, perfect for those who desire a bolder look.
3. **Hybrid Lash Extensions**: A combination of classic and volume techniques, offering a balanced look that suits various eye shapes and styles.

At HA Beauty, we pride ourselves on our expertise in lash extensions. Our trained professionals ensure that each application is done with precision and care, allowing our clients to enjoy stunning, long-lasting results. We also provide essential aftercare tips to maintain the longevity of your lash extensions, ensuring that you can enjoy your beautiful lashes for weeks to come.

Our mission is to empower women through beauty, helping them feel confident and radiant with every blink.

================
File: _posts/lashes.md
================
---
title: "The Comprehensive Guide to Lash Extensions"
excerpt: "Everything you need to know about lash extensions, trends, and professional insights."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
date: "2024-12-12T05:35:07.322Z"
author:
  name: Hang
  picture: "/assets/blog/authors/hang.png"
ogImage:
  url: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
---
## The Comprehensive Guide to Lash Extensions

Lash extensions have become a popular beauty trend, offering a way to enhance the length and volume of natural lashes. This guide will provide you with everything you need to know about lash extensions, including the different types, application techniques, and aftercare tips.

### Types of Lash Extensions

1. **Classic Lash Extensions**: These are individual lashes applied to each natural lash, providing a natural look.
2. **Volume Lash Extensions**: Multiple lightweight lashes are applied to each natural lash, creating a fuller and more dramatic effect.
3. **Hybrid Lash Extensions**: A mix of classic and volume techniques, offering a balanced look.

### Application Techniques

The application of lash extensions should always be performed by a trained professional to ensure safety and optimal results. The process typically involves:

- A consultation to determine the desired look.
- Preparation of the natural lashes.
- Application of the extensions using a specialized adhesive.

### Trends in Lash Extensions

As the beauty industry evolves, so do the trends in lash extensions. Some current trends include:

- **Colored Lash Extensions**: Adding a pop of color to your lashes for a fun and unique look.
- **Lash Lifts**: A treatment that curls and lifts natural lashes without extensions, providing a more natural enhancement.

### Professional Insights

To maintain the longevity of your lash extensions, proper aftercare is essential. Here are some tips:

- Avoid water and steam for the first 24 hours after application.
- Use oil-free makeup removers.
- Schedule regular touch-ups every 2-3 weeks to keep your lashes looking their best.

At HA Beauty Lashes, we are committed to providing our clients with the best lash extension services and education. Our goal is to help you achieve stunning, effortless beauty that lasts.

title: "The Art of Nail Design"
excerpt: "Discover the rich history and business origins of nail design."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
date: "2024-12-14T05:35:07.322Z"
author:
  name: Hang
  picture: "/assets/blog/authors/hang.png"
ogImage:
  url: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
---

Nail design has a rich history that dates back thousands of years, with its origins rooted in ancient civilizations.  The art of nail design has evolved significantly over the years, influenced by cultural trends, fashion, and technological advancements. 

In ancient Egypt, both men and women adorned their nails with henna, a practice that symbolized wealth and status. The use of nail polish can be traced back to the Ming Dynasty in China, where a mixture of beeswax, egg whites, and colored powders was used to create beautiful nail colors.

As the centuries progressed, nail design became more sophisticated. The introduction of modern nail polish in the 20th century revolutionized the industry, allowing for a wider variety of colors and finishes. Today, nail design is not just a beauty trend but a form of self-expression, with techniques ranging from simple manicures to intricate nail art.

At HA Beauty, we celebrate the art of nail design by offering a range of services that highlight the beauty and creativity of our clients. Our skilled technicians are trained in the latest techniques and trends, ensuring that every client leaves feeling beautiful and confident.

import Container from "@/app/_components/container";

type Props = {

};

const Alert = ({ preview }: Props) => {
  return (
    <div
      className={cn("border-b dark:bg-slate-800", {
        "bg-neutral-800 border-neutral-800 text-white": preview,
        "bg-neutral-50 border-neutral-200": !preview,
      })}
    >
      <Container>
        <div className="py-2 text-center text-sm">
          {preview ? (
            <>
              This page is a preview.{" "}
              <a
                href="/api/exit-preview"
                className="underline hover:text-teal-300 duration-200 transition-colors"
              >
                Click here

              to exit preview mode.

            <>
              The source code for this blog is{" "}

                href={`https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/examples/${EXAMPLE_PATH}`}

              >
                available on GitHub
              </a>
              .
            </>
          )}
        </div>
      </Container>
    </div>
  );
};

export default Alert;

.switch {
  all: unset;
  position: absolute;
  right: 20px;
  top: 70px;
  display: inline-block;
  color: currentColor;
  border-radius: 50%;
  border: 1px dashed currentColor;
  cursor: pointer;
  --size: 24px;
  height: var(--size);
  width: var(--size);
  transition: all 0.3s ease-in-out 0s !important;
}

[data-mode="system"] .switch::after {
  position: absolute;
  height: 100%;
  width: 100%;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-size: calc(var(--size) / 2);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  content: "A";
}

[data-mode="light"] .switch {
  box-shadow: 0 0 50px 10px yellow;
  background-color: yellow;
  border: 1px solid orangered;
}

[data-mode="dark"] .switch {
  box-shadow: calc(var(--size) / 4) calc(var(--size) / -4) calc(var(--size) / 8)
    inset #fff;
  border: none;
  background: transparent;
  animation: n linear 0.5s;
}

@keyframes n {
  40% {
    transform: rotate(-15deg);
  }
  80% {
    transform: rotate(10deg);
  }
  0%,
  100% {
    transform: rotate(0deg);
  }
}

"use client";

import styles from "./switch.module.css";
import { memo, useEffect, useState } from "react";

declare global {
  var updateDOM: () => void;
}

type ColorSchemePreference = "system" | "dark" | "light";

const STORAGE_KEY = "nextjs-blog-starter-theme";
const modes: ColorSchemePreference[] = ["system", "dark", "light"];

/** to reuse updateDOM function defined inside injected script */

/** function to be injected in script tag for avoiding FOUC (Flash of Unstyled Content) */
export const NoFOUCScript = (storageKey: string) => {
  /* can not use outside constants or function as this script will be injected in a different context */
  const [SYSTEM, DARK, LIGHT] = ["system", "dark", "light"];

  /** Modify transition globally to avoid patched transitions */
  const modifyTransition = () => {
    const css = document.createElement("style");
    css.textContent = "*,*:after,*:before{transition:none !important;}";
    document.head.appendChild(css);

    return () => {
      /* Force restyle */
      getComputedStyle(document.body);
      /* Wait for next tick before removing */
      setTimeout(() => document.head.removeChild(css), 1);
    };
  };

  const media = matchMedia(`(prefers-color-scheme: ${DARK})`);

  /** function to add remove dark class */
  window.updateDOM = () => {
    const restoreTransitions = modifyTransition();
    const mode = localStorage.getItem(storageKey) ?? SYSTEM;
    const systemMode = media.matches ? DARK : LIGHT;
    const resolvedMode = mode === SYSTEM ? systemMode : mode;
    const classList = document.documentElement.classList;
    if (resolvedMode === DARK) classList.add(DARK);
    else classList.remove(DARK);
    document.documentElement.setAttribute("data-mode", mode);
    restoreTransitions();
  };
  window.updateDOM();
  media.addEventListener("change", window.updateDOM);
};

let updateDOM: () => void;

/**
 * Switch button to quickly toggle user preference.
 */
const Switch = () => {
  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ColorSchemePreference>(
    () =>
      ((typeof localStorage !== "undefined" &&
        localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY)) ??
        "system") as ColorSchemePreference,
  );

  useEffect(() => {
    // store global functions to local variables to avoid any interference
    updateDOM = window.updateDOM;
    /** Sync the tabs */
    addEventListener("storage", (e: StorageEvent): void => {
      e.key === STORAGE_KEY && setMode(e.newValue as ColorSchemePreference);
    });
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, mode);
    updateDOM();
  }, [mode]);

  /** toggle mode */
  const handleModeSwitch = () => {
    const index = modes.indexOf(mode);
    setMode(modes[(index + 1) % modes.length]);
  };
  return (
    <button
      suppressHydrationWarning
      className={styles.switch}
      onClick={handleModeSwitch}
    />
  );
};

const Script = memo(() => (
  <script
    dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
      __html: `(${NoFOUCScript.toString()})('${STORAGE_KEY}')`,
    }}
  />
));

/**
 * This component wich applies classes and transitions.
 */
export const ThemeSwitcher = () => {
  return (
    <>
      <Script />
      <Switch />
    </>
  );
};

import { Metadata } from "next";
import { notFound } from "next/navigation";
import { getAllPosts, getPostBySlug } from "@/lib/api";
import { CMS_NAME } from "@/lib/constants";
import markdownToHtml from "@/lib/markdownToHtml";
import Alert from "@/app/_components/alert";
import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import Header from "@/app/_components/header";
import { PostBody } from "@/app/_components/post-body";
import { PostHeader } from "@/app/_components/post-header";

export default async function Post(props: Params) {
  const params = await props.params;
  const post = getPostBySlug(params.slug);

  if (!post) {
    return notFound();
  }

  const content = await markdownToHtml(post.content || "");

  return (
    <main>
      <Alert preview={post.preview} />
      <Container>
        <Header />
        <article className="mb-32">
          <PostHeader
            title={post.title}
            coverImage={post.coverImage}
            date={post.date}
            author={post.author}
          />
          <PostBody content={content} />
        </article>
      </Container>
    </main>
  );
}

type Params = {
  params: Promise<{
    slug: string;
  }>;
};

export async function generateMetadata(props: Params): Promise<Metadata> {
  const params = await props.params;
  const post = getPostBySlug(params.slug);

  if (!post) {
    return notFound();
  }

  const title = `${post.title} | Next.js Blog Example with ${CMS_NAME}`;

  return {
    title,
    openGraph: {
      title,
      images: [post.ogImage.url],
    },
  };
}

export async function generateStaticParams() {
  const posts = getAllPosts();

  return posts.map((post) => ({
    slug: post.slug,
  }));
}

import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import { HeroPost } from "@/app/_components/hero-post";
import { Intro } from "@/app/_components/intro";
import { MoreStories } from "@/app/_components/more-stories";
import { getAllPosts } from "@/lib/api";

export default function Index() {
  const allPosts = getAllPosts();

  const heroPost = allPosts[0];

  const morePosts = allPosts.slice(1);

  return (
    <main>
      <Container>
        <Intro />
        <HeroPost
          title={heroPost.title}
          coverImage={heroPost.coverImage}
          date={heroPost.date}
          author={heroPost.author}
          slug={heroPost.slug}
          excerpt={heroPost.excerpt}
        />
        {morePosts.length > 0 && <MoreStories posts={morePosts} />}
      </Container>
    </main>
  );
}

import { Post } from "@/interfaces/post";
import fs from "fs";
import matter from "gray-matter";
import { join } from "path";

const postsDirectory = join(process.cwd(), "_posts");

export function getPostSlugs() {
  return fs.readdirSync(postsDirectory);
}

export function getPostBySlug(slug: string) {
  const realSlug = slug.replace(/\.md$/, "");
  const fullPath = join(postsDirectory, `${realSlug}.md`);
  const fileContents = fs.readFileSync(fullPath, "utf8");
  const { data, content } = matter(fileContents);

  return { ...data, slug: realSlug, content } as Post;
}

export function getAllPosts(): Post[] {
  const slugs = getPostSlugs();
  const posts = slugs
    .map((slug) => getPostBySlug(slug))
    // sort posts by date in descending order
    .sort((post1, post2) => (post1.date > post2.date ? -1 : 1));
  return posts;
}

import { remark } from "remark";
import html from "remark-html";

export default async function markdownToHtml(markdown: string) {
  const result = await remark().use(html).process(markdown);
  return result.toString();
}

# Issue title: Instagram Icon and website link integration in the footer 

## Benefit Hypothesis

Integrating an Instagram icon and a direct link to the main website in the footer will enhance user engagement by providing quick, easy access to our social media presence and primary online resource. This update is expected to:

- **Increase Social Media Engagement:** By prominently displaying the Instagram icon, users are more likely to connect with and follow our social media account, leading to higher engagement rates.
- **Improve Navigation:** Offering a direct link to the main website in the footer simplifies user navigation, ensuring that visitors can easily explore more of our content and offerings.
- **Boost Brand Exposure:** The dual-link approach reinforces our brand presence across platforms, potentially increasing trust and conversion rates as users seamlessly transition between social media and our website.
- **Enhance User Experience:** The clean integration of social media and main website links contributes to a modern, user-friendly interface that aligns with best practices in web development and design.

## Objective
Enable quick access to the website owner's Instagram profile, and include a link in the footer to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).

## Story Context
Users want a direct way to connect with the website owner on social media and navigate to the main website.

## Technical Requirements
- **Framework:** Next.js
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS
- **Language:** TypeScript

## Codebase Changes

1. **package.json**
   - Add `react-icons` as a dependency ( No comments should be added to the code.)
2. **Footer Component**
   - Import the Instagram icon from `react-icons`.
   - Add the Instagram icon with a link to: [https://www.instagram.com/habeauty.de/](https://www.instagram.com/habeauty.de/).
   - Add a link to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).

## Implementation Steps

1. Install the `react-icons` package and update the `package.json`.
2. Add the Instagram icon to the footer component.
3. Link the Instagram icon to the Instagram profile.
4. Add a link in the footer that directs to the main website.
5. No comments should be added to the code.

## Acceptance Criteria

- The icon must be present in the footer.
- The Instagram icon is correctly imported from `react-icons`.
- The Instagram icon is linked to the Instagram profile.
- The footer includes a link to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).
- All new dependencies are properly added to the `package.json`.
- No comments should be added to the code.

## Key Guidelines

- Write clean, maintainable code.
- Follow Next.js and Tailwind CSS best practices.
- Ensure the integration is both functional and visually appealing.
- No comments should be added to the code.

---

## About HA Beauty Lashes

HA Beauty Lashes was established in 2020 in Glienicke Nordbahn, as an extension of the renowned Ha Beauty brand. Our journey began with a passion for enhancing natural beauty through expertly crafted lash extensions. Since our inception, we have dedicated ourselves to providing high-quality lash services that not only beautify but also empower our clients.

Our team of skilled professionals is trained in the latest techniques and trends in lash extensions, ensuring that every client receives personalized care and attention. We believe that every woman deserves to feel beautiful and confident, and our mission is to help them achieve that effortlessly.

At HA Beauty Lashes, we pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction. We continuously strive to innovate and improve our services, making us the go-to destination for lash extensions in Glienicke and beyond.

---
title: "The Transformative Power of Lash Extensions"
excerpt: "Explore the transformative power of lash extensions and how they enhance natural beauty."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
date: "2024-12-14T05:35:07.322Z"
author:
  name: Hang
  picture: "/assets/blog/authors/hang.png"
ogImage:
  url: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
---

Lash extensions have become a revolutionary beauty trend, offering women the opportunity to enhance their natural beauty effortlessly. Since their introduction, lash extensions have transformed the way women approach their beauty routines, providing a solution for those seeking longer, fuller lashes without the need for mascara.

There are several types of lash extensions available, each designed to cater to different preferences and styles:

1. **Classic Lash Extensions**: These involve applying a single extension to each natural lash, creating a natural and elegant look.
2. **Volume Lash Extensions**: This technique uses multiple lightweight extensions to create a fuller, more dramatic effect, perfect for those who desire a bolder look.
3. **Hybrid Lash Extensions**: A combination of classic and volume techniques, offering a balanced look that suits various eye shapes and styles.

At HA Beauty, we pride ourselves on our expertise in lash extensions. Our trained professionals ensure that each application is done with precision and care, allowing our clients to enjoy stunning, long-lasting results. We also provide essential aftercare tips to maintain the longevity of your lash extensions, ensuring that you can enjoy your beautiful lashes for weeks to come.

Our mission is to empower women through beauty, helping them feel confident and radiant with every blink.

---
title: "The Comprehensive Guide to Lash Extensions"
excerpt: "Everything you need to know about lash extensions, trends, and professional insights."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
date: "2024-12-12T05:35:07.322Z"
author:
  name: Hang
  picture: "/assets/blog/authors/hang.png"
ogImage:
  url: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
---
## The Comprehensive Guide to Lash Extensions

Lash extensions have become a popular beauty trend, offering a way to enhance the length and volume of natural lashes. This guide will provide you with everything you need to know about lash extensions, including the different types, application techniques, and aftercare tips.

### Types of Lash Extensions

1. **Classic Lash Extensions**: These are individual lashes applied to each natural lash, providing a natural look.
2. **Volume Lash Extensions**: Multiple lightweight lashes are applied to each natural lash, creating a fuller and more dramatic effect.
3. **Hybrid Lash Extensions**: A mix of classic and volume techniques, offering a balanced look.

### Application Techniques

The application of lash extensions should always be performed by a trained professional to ensure safety and optimal results. The process typically involves:

- A consultation to determine the desired look.
- Preparation of the natural lashes.
- Application of the extensions using a specialized adhesive.

### Trends in Lash Extensions

As the beauty industry evolves, so do the trends in lash extensions. Some current trends include:

- **Colored Lash Extensions**: Adding a pop of color to your lashes for a fun and unique look.
- **Lash Lifts**: A treatment that curls and lifts natural lashes without extensions, providing a more natural enhancement.

### Professional Insights

To maintain the longevity of your lash extensions, proper aftercare is essential. Here are some tips:

- Avoid water and steam for the first 24 hours after application.
- Use oil-free makeup removers.
- Schedule regular touch-ups every 2-3 weeks to keep your lashes looking their best.

At HA Beauty Lashes, we are committed to providing our clients with the best lash extension services and education. Our goal is to help you achieve stunning, effortless beauty that lasts.

File: _posts/nails.md

---
title: "The Art of Nail Design"
excerpt: "Discover the rich history and business origins of nail design."
coverImage: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
date: "2024-12-14T05:35:07.322Z"
author:
  name: Hang
  picture: "/assets/blog/authors/hang.png"
ogImage:
  url: "/assets/blog/preview/cover.jpg"
---

Nail design has a rich history that dates back thousands of years, with its origins rooted in ancient civilizations.  The art of nail design has evolved significantly over the years, influenced by cultural trends, fashion, and technological advancements. 

In ancient Egypt, both men and women adorned their nails with henna, a practice that symbolized wealth and status. The use of nail polish can be traced back to the Ming Dynasty in China, where a mixture of beeswax, egg whites, and colored powders was used to create beautiful nail colors.

As the centuries progressed, nail design became more sophisticated. The introduction of modern nail polish in the 20th century revolutionized the industry, allowing for a wider variety of colors and finishes. Today, nail design is not just a beauty trend but a form of self-expression, with techniques ranging from simple manicures to intricate nail art.

At HA Beauty, we celebrate the art of nail design by offering a range of services that highlight the beauty and creativity of our clients. Our skilled technicians are trained in the latest techniques and trends, ensuring that every client leaves feeling beautiful and confident.

import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import { EXAMPLE_PATH } from "@/lib/constants";
import cn from "classnames";

type Props = {
  preview?: boolean;
};

const Alert = ({ preview }: Props) => {
  return (
    <div
      className={cn("border-b dark:bg-slate-800", {
        "bg-neutral-800 border-neutral-800 text-white": preview,
        "bg-neutral-50 border-neutral-200": !preview,
      })}
    >
      <Container>
        <div className="py-2 text-center text-sm">
          {preview ? (
            <>
              This page is a preview.{" "}
              <a
                href="/api/exit-preview"
                className="underline hover:text-teal-300 duration-200 transition-colors"
              >
                Click here
              </a>{" "}
              to exit preview mode.
            </>
          ) : (
            <>
              The source code for this blog is{" "}
              <a
                href={`https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/examples/${EXAMPLE_PATH}`}
                className="underline hover:text-blue-600 duration-200 transition-colors"
              >
                available on GitHub
              </a>
              .
            </>
          )}
        </div>
      </Container>
    </div>
  );
};

export default Alert;

import cn from "classnames";
import Link from "next/link";
import Image from "next/image";

type Props = {
  title: string;
  src: string;
  slug?: string;
};

const CoverImage = ({ title, src, slug }: Props) => {
  const image = (
    <Image
      src={src}
      alt={`Cover Image for ${title}`}
      className={cn("shadow-sm w-full", {
        "hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow duration-200": slug,
      })}
      width={1300}
      height={630}
    />
  );
  return (
    <div className="sm:mx-0">
      {slug ? (
        <Link href={`/posts/${slug}`} aria-label={title}>
          {image}
        </Link>
      ) : (
        image
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default CoverImage;

import { parseISO, format } from "date-fns";

type Props = {
  dateString: string;
};

const DateFormatter = ({ dateString }: Props) => {
  const date = parseISO(dateString);
  return <time dateTime={dateString}>{format(date, "LLLL	d, yyyy")}</time>;
};

export default DateFormatter;

import Avatar from "@/app/_components/avatar";
import CoverImage from "@/app/_components/cover-image";
import { type Author } from "@/interfaces/author";
import Link from "next/link";
import DateFormatter from "./date-formatter";

type Props = {
  title: string;
  coverImage: string;
  date: string;
  excerpt: string;
  author: Author;
  slug: string;
};

export function HeroPost({
  title,
  coverImage,
  date,
  excerpt,
  author,
  slug,
}: Props) {
  return (
    <section>
      <div className="mb-8 md:mb-16">
        <CoverImage title={title} src={coverImage} slug={slug} />
      </div>
      <div className="md:grid md:grid-cols-2 md:gap-x-16 lg:gap-x-8 mb-20 md:mb-28">
        <div>
          <h3 className="mb-4 text-4xl lg:text-5xl leading-tight">
            <Link href={`/posts/${slug}`} className="hover:underline">
              {title}
            </Link>
          </h3>
          <div className="mb-4 md:mb-0 text-lg">
            <DateFormatter dateString={date} />
          </div>
        </div>
        <div>
          <p className="text-lg leading-relaxed mb-4">{excerpt}</p>
          <Avatar name={author.name} picture={author.picture} />
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}

import { type Author } from "@/interfaces/author";
import Link from "next/link";
import Avatar from "./avatar";
import CoverImage from "./cover-image";
import DateFormatter from "./date-formatter";

type Props = {
  title: string;
  coverImage: string;
  date: string;
  excerpt: string;
  author: Author;
  slug: string;
};

export function PostPreview({
  title,
  coverImage,
  date,
  excerpt,
  author,
  slug,
}: Props) {
  return (
    <div>
      <div className="mb-5">
        <CoverImage slug={slug} title={title} src={coverImage} />
      </div>
      <h3 className="text-3xl mb-3 leading-snug">
        <Link href={`/posts/${slug}`} className="hover:underline">
          {title}
        </Link>
      </h3>
      <div className="text-lg mb-4">

      </div>

.switch {
  all: unset;
  position: absolute;
  right: 20px;
  top: 70px;
  display: inline-block;
  color: currentColor;
  border-radius: 50%;
  border: 1px dashed currentColor;
  cursor: pointer;
  --size: 24px;
  height: var(--size);
  width: var(--size);
  transition: all 0.3s ease-in-out 0s !important;
}

[data-mode="system"] .switch::after {
  position: absolute;
  height: 100%;
  width: 100%;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-size: calc(var(--size) / 2);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  content: "A";
}

[data-mode="light"] .switch {
  box-shadow: 0 0 50px 10px yellow;
  background-color: yellow;
  border: 1px solid orangered;
}

[data-mode="dark"] .switch {
  box-shadow: calc(var(--size) / 4) calc(var(--size) / -4) calc(var(--size) / 8)
    inset #fff;
  border: none;
  background: transparent;
  animation: n linear 0.5s;
}

@keyframes n {
  40% {
    transform: rotate(-15deg);
  }
  80% {
    transform: rotate(10deg);
  }
  0%,
  100% {
    transform: rotate(0deg);
  }
}

"use client";

import styles from "./switch.module.css";
import { memo, useEffect, useState } from "react";

declare global {
  var updateDOM: () => void;
}

type ColorSchemePreference = "system" | "dark" | "light";

const STORAGE_KEY = "nextjs-blog-starter-theme";
const modes: ColorSchemePreference[] = ["system", "dark", "light"];

/** to reuse updateDOM function defined inside injected script */

/** function to be injected in script tag for avoiding FOUC (Flash of Unstyled Content) */
export const NoFOUCScript = (storageKey: string) => {
  /* can not use outside constants or function as this script will be injected in a different context */
  const [SYSTEM, DARK, LIGHT] = ["system", "dark", "light"];

  /** Modify transition globally to avoid patched transitions */
  const modifyTransition = () => {
    const css = document.createElement("style");
    css.textContent = "*,*:after,*:before{transition:none !important;}";
    document.head.appendChild(css);

    return () => {
      /* Force restyle */
      getComputedStyle(document.body);
      /* Wait for next tick before removing */
      setTimeout(() => document.head.removeChild(css), 1);
    };
  };

  const media = matchMedia(`(prefers-color-scheme: ${DARK})`);

  /** function to add remove dark class */
  window.updateDOM = () => {
    const restoreTransitions = modifyTransition();
    const mode = localStorage.getItem(storageKey) ?? SYSTEM;
    const systemMode = media.matches ? DARK : LIGHT;
    const resolvedMode = mode === SYSTEM ? systemMode : mode;
    const classList = document.documentElement.classList;
    if (resolvedMode === DARK) classList.add(DARK);
    else classList.remove(DARK);
    document.documentElement.setAttribute("data-mode", mode);
    restoreTransitions();
  };
  window.updateDOM();
  media.addEventListener("change", window.updateDOM);
};

let updateDOM: () => void;

/**
 * Switch button to quickly toggle user preference.
 */
const Switch = () => {
  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ColorSchemePreference>(
    () =>
      ((typeof localStorage !== "undefined" &&
        localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY)) ??
        "system") as ColorSchemePreference,
  );

  useEffect(() => {
    // store global functions to local variables to avoid any interference
    updateDOM = window.updateDOM;
    /** Sync the tabs */
    addEventListener("storage", (e: StorageEvent): void => {
      e.key === STORAGE_KEY && setMode(e.newValue as ColorSchemePreference);
    });
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, mode);
    updateDOM();
  }, [mode]);

  /** toggle mode */
  const handleModeSwitch = () => {
    const index = modes.indexOf(mode);
    setMode(modes[(index + 1) % modes.length]);
  };
  return (
    <button
      suppressHydrationWarning
      className={styles.switch}
      onClick={handleModeSwitch}
    />
  );
};

const Script = memo(() => (
  <script
    dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
      __html: `(${NoFOUCScript.toString()})('${STORAGE_KEY}')`,
    }}
  />
));

/**
 * This component wich applies classes and transitions.
 */
export const ThemeSwitcher = () => {
  return (
    <>
      <Script />
      <Switch />
    </>
  );
};

import { Metadata } from "next";
import { notFound } from "next/navigation";
import { getAllPosts, getPostBySlug } from "@/lib/api";
import { CMS_NAME } from "@/lib/constants";
import markdownToHtml from "@/lib/markdownToHtml";
import Alert from "@/app/_components/alert";
import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import Header from "@/app/_components/header";
import { PostBody } from "@/app/_components/post-body";
import { PostHeader } from "@/app/_components/post-header";

export default async function Post(props: Params) {
  const params = await props.params;
  const post = getPostBySlug(params.slug);

  if (!post) {
    return notFound();
  }

  const content = await markdownToHtml(post.content || "");

  return (
    <main>
      <Alert preview={post.preview} />
      <Container>
        <Header />
        <article className="mb-32">
          <PostHeader
            title={post.title}
            coverImage={post.coverImage}
            date={post.date}
            author={post.author}
          />
          <PostBody content={content} />
        </article>
      </Container>
    </main>
  );
}

type Params = {
  params: Promise<{
    slug: string;
  }>;
};

export async function generateMetadata(props: Params): Promise<Metadata> {
  const params = await props.params;
  const post = getPostBySlug(params.slug);

  if (!post) {
    return notFound();
  }

  const title = `${post.title} | Next.js Blog Example with ${CMS_NAME}`;

  return {
    title,
    openGraph: {
      title,
      images: [post.ogImage.url],
    },
  };
}

export async function generateStaticParams() {
  const posts = getAllPosts();

  return posts.map((post) => ({
    slug: post.slug,
  }));
}

import Container from "@/app/_components/container";
import { HeroPost } from "@/app/_components/hero-post";
import { Intro } from "@/app/_components/intro";
import { MoreStories } from "@/app/_components/more-stories";
import { getAllPosts } from "@/lib/api";

export default function Index() {
  const allPosts = getAllPosts();

  const heroPost = allPosts[0];

  const morePosts = allPosts.slice(1);

  return (
    <main>
      <Container>
        <Intro />
        <HeroPost
          title={heroPost.title}
          coverImage={heroPost.coverImage}
          date={heroPost.date}
          author={heroPost.author}
          slug={heroPost.slug}
          excerpt={heroPost.excerpt}
        />
        {morePosts.length > 0 && <MoreStories posts={morePosts} />}
      </Container>
    </main>
  );
}

import { Post } from "@/interfaces/post";
import fs from "fs";
import matter from "gray-matter";
import { join } from "path";

const postsDirectory = join(process.cwd(), "_posts");

export function getPostSlugs() {
  return fs.readdirSync(postsDirectory);
}

export function getPostBySlug(slug: string) {
  const realSlug = slug.replace(/\.md$/, "");
  const fullPath = join(postsDirectory, `${realSlug}.md`);
  const fileContents = fs.readFileSync(fullPath, "utf8");
  const { data, content } = matter(fileContents);

  return { ...data, slug: realSlug, content } as Post;
}

export function getAllPosts(): Post[] {
  const slugs = getPostSlugs();
  const posts = slugs
    .map((slug) => getPostBySlug(slug))
    // sort posts by date in descending order
    .sort((post1, post2) => (post1.date > post2.date ? -1 : 1));
  return posts;
}

import { remark } from "remark";
import html from "remark-html";

export default async function markdownToHtml(markdown: string) {
  const result = await remark().use(html).process(markdown);
  return result.toString();
}

# Issue title: Instagram Icon and website link integration in the footer 

## Benefit Hypothesis

Integrating an Instagram icon and a direct link to the main website in the footer will enhance user engagement by providing quick, easy access to our social media presence and primary online resource. This update is expected to:

- **Increase Social Media Engagement:** By prominently displaying the Instagram icon, users are more likely to connect with and follow our social media account, leading to higher engagement rates.
- **Improve Navigation:** Offering a direct link to the main website in the footer simplifies user navigation, ensuring that visitors can easily explore more of our content and offerings.
- **Boost Brand Exposure:** The dual-link approach reinforces our brand presence across platforms, potentially increasing trust and conversion rates as users seamlessly transition between social media and our website.
- **Enhance User Experience:** The clean integration of social media and main website links contributes to a modern, user-friendly interface that aligns with best practices in web development and design.

## Objective
Enable quick access to the website owner's Instagram profile, and include a link in the footer to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).

## Story Context
Users want a direct way to connect with the website owner on social media and navigate to the main website.

## Technical Requirements
- **Framework:** Next.js
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS
- **Language:** TypeScript

## Codebase Changes

1. **package.json**
   - Add `react-icons` as a dependency ( No comments should be added to the code.)
2. **Footer Component**
   - Import the Instagram icon from `react-icons`.
   - Add the Instagram icon with a link to: [https://www.instagram.com/habeauty.de/](https://www.instagram.com/habeauty.de/).
   - Add a link to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).

## Implementation Steps

1. Install the `react-icons` package and update the `package.json`.
2. Add the Instagram icon to the footer component.
3. Link the Instagram icon to the Instagram profile.
4. Add a link in the footer that directs to the main website.
5. No comments should be added to the code.

## Acceptance Criteria

- The icon must be present in the footer.
- The Instagram icon is correctly imported from `react-icons`.
- The Instagram icon is linked to the Instagram profile.
- The footer includes a link to the main website: [https://www.ha-beauty.de](https://www.ha-beauty.de).
- All new dependencies are properly added to the `package.json`.
- No comments should be added to the code.

## Key Guidelines

- Write clean, maintainable code.
- Follow Next.js and Tailwind CSS best practices.
- Ensure the integration is both functional and visually appealing.
- No comments should be added to the code.

# Issue Title: Implement "Scroll to Top" Button for Improved Navigation

## Benefit Hypothesis
Providing users with a quick and accessible way to return to the top of the page will improve navigation for long-page content.

## Objective
Develop and integrate a responsive "Scroll to Top" button that enhances user navigation across all pages, especially those with long content.

## Story Context
Users navigating through long content pages need a convenient way to return to the top. The existing `scrolltotop.tsx` file is currently empty and must be implemented to include the "Scroll to Top" button functionality. Once completed, this component should be imported and integrated into `footer.tsx` to ensure it is available on all pages.

## Technical Requirements
- **Framework:** Next.js
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS
- **Language:** TypeScript

## Implementation Steps

1. **Modify `scrolltotop.tsx`:**
   - Create a "Scroll to Top" component in Next.js and export it.
   - Mark the component as a client-side component by including the `'use client'` directive.
   - Implement smooth scrolling functionality so that clicking the button scrolls the page back to the top.
   - Style the button using Tailwind CSS to have a black background and contrasting text 
   - Ensure the button design is responsive and adapts to various screen sizes.

2. **Integrate the Component in `footer.tsx`:**
   - Import the `scrolltotop` component.
   - Position the button at the bottom-left corner of the page.
   - Ensure the button is included in the footer layout, making it available on all pages.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Clicking the "Scroll to Top" button smoothly returns the user to the top of the page.
- The button is styled in black with Tailwind CSS and has contrasting text.
- The `scrolltotop` component is correctly imported and integrated into `footer.tsx`.
